page.title: 04ANIMALS
page.content: {ANIMALS IN THE DUNSMORE AREA The Edible Doremouse or Glis_Glis was released into the area by Lord Rothschild of Tring. Attractive, with large ears and a bushy tail, it is now a nuisance as it strips the bark of trees. Often hibernating in the roof space of houses, it is a noisy guest, becoming very active during the night. The English Doremouse is more widely distributed but is one of our endangered spiecies. The Muntjac deer is an escapee from Woburn Park in Beds. It can often be seen in woods or open grasslands, and has a dog_like bark, usually heard in the early morning. Foxes are very common; the cubs seen from May onwards. Since Badgers became a protected species, there are many more sets. In search for insects, they cause havoc, digging up grass on golf courses and lawns.
